> My results look like this:
> 
>     [junit] Running com.wellsfargo.ibk.ivs.TestIndexSearchAdapter
>     [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
>     [junit] TEST com.wellsfargo.ibk.ivs.TestIndexSearchAdapter FAILED
> 
> So I see I have an error there, but I see no information about
> which tests were run, or, if I got an uncaught exception,
> I see no stacktrace either.
> 
> How can I specify, either in the test itself or in my Ant
> build.xml file, that I want it to tell me which test is
> being run, where it failed, etc?

Ant does this by default. I think it's pretty silly but I guess it makes
sense from Ant's perspective.

You'll need to add an outputter to your junit task with:

<junit ... >
  < ... />
  <formatter type="plain" />
  < ... />
</junit>

For more stuff you can do with the junit task, see the Ant manual at
http://ant.apache.org/manual/index.html . The Junit task is listed under Ant
Tasks -> Optional Tasks.

- John
